In partition. Schermerhorn and Clute, and Maria the wife of Miller, were seised in fee as tenants in common in equal shares of a house and lot in the city of Schenectady. Miller had issue by his wife, born alive. Proceedings were then commenced in partition, and this Court ordered a sale of , . , . . . the premises by the commissioners, pursuant to the act, (1 R. L. 510, s. 5,) and on the 25th day of December, 1823, the premises were sold to Resolved Given, for $344 50. Before this, on the 26th July, 1823, Given had purchased all the interest of Miller, at a Sheriff's, sale upon execution, and taken a certificate as required by statute, (sess. 43, ch. 184, s. 1.)
